titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lois Gould Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:11

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers include writings, correspondence, printed material, personal papers, photographs, audiovisual material and electronic files that document the writing career of Lois Gould, with the bulk of the material spanning 1970 to 2002. The collection consists chiefly of drafts of Gould's writings with related material such as notes, proofs, correspondence, promotional material, and reviews. The collection also includes files related to an unpublished magazine, Boomer, as well as notebooks, diaries, agendas, and subject files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 9 (videotapes): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 32 (original computer disk): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 33 (reel-to-reel tape): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Lois Gould Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lois Gould Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit. This collection received preliminary processing in 2007. Further organization and description were carried out in 2011.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Lois Gould, 1931-2002
bioghist.p: Lois Gould, American journalist and novelist whose work addressed the inner lives of women and topics such as infidelity and marital relationships, was born in Manhattan December 18, 1931 and died May 29, 2002. Among her writings are the novels Such Good Friends (1970), Necessary Objects (1972), Final Analysis (1974), A Sea-Change (1976), La Presidenta (1981), and Medusa's Gift (1991), a collection of essays titled Not Responsible for Personal Articles (1978), the memoir Mommy Dressing: A Love Story, After a Fashion (1998), and a feminist children's book X: A Fabulous Child's Story (1978).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Writings, 1961-2002. II. Book Files, 1966-2001. III. Boomer Magazine Files, 1999-2005. IV. Diaries, Notebooks and Agendas, 1973-2002. V. Other Papers, 1940-2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers include writings, correspondence, printed material, personal papers, photographs, audiovisual material and electronic files that document the writing career of Lois Gould, with the bulk of the material spanning 1970 to 2002. The collection consists chiefly of drafts of Gould's writings with related material such as notes, proofs, correspondence, promotional material, and reviews. The collection also includes files related to an unpublished magazine, Boomer , as well as notebooks, diaries, agendas, and subject files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. consists of drafts, proofs, and printed versions of writings by Lois Gould.

"Confessions of a Renovated House Car," drafts
"How to Hold a Man by Giving Him His Freedom," drafts, printed version, and correspondence
Mommy Dressing , excerpt published in New York Times
"Shock Around the Clock," drafts and printed version
"Winking at Bimbos," drafts and printed version (photocopy)
"The Trouble with Being the Supremes," drafts
New York Times columns, reader's letters

No Brakes , critique of work in progress
"The Kiss of My Nickel," draft fragment
"Pornography for Women," correspondence and research material
Published articles, drafts and printed versions

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original disk is restricted. Copies of electronic files are available through Access Services. Disk # 20070206-1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of correspondence, fan mail, notes, promotional material, and reviews relating to Gould's major works. These works include Final Analysis , La Presidenta , Medusa's Gift , Mommy Dressing: A Love Story, After a Fashion , Necessary Objects , No Brakes: a Novel , Not Responsible for Personal Articles , A Sea Change , So You Want to be a Working Mother , Subject to Change , and Such Good Friends .

unittitle.title: So You Want to be a Working Mother

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of files related to an unpublished magazine, Boomer , conceived by Lois Gould.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Copies of electronic files are available through Access Services: Disk #1.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV consists of notes, notebooks, datebooks, diaries and journals. The notebooks contain drafts of writings and personal journal entries. Datebooks record Gould's appointments and activities from 1973 to 2002. The Diaries contain both original and edited versions of Gould's personal memoir.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V consists of personal papers and subject files relating to Lois Gould's personal and professional life. Files include drafts of writings, printed material, correspondence and other material relating to the subject. Personal papers include correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes audiocassette titled "Lois Gould ESCASAP 'The Adolescent Girl,' 1978 October 6."
